result.execSummary:
The defendant David M Booczko was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
With credit for 3 days time served. Court ordered the 1st 30 days of Defendant's sentence be without release privileges at the House of Correction (HOC). After this initial period of incarceration, if there are no major rules violations, and the Defendant is accepted into the Day Report Program, the Defendant may serve the balance of the sentence with release privileges to attend the Day Reporting Program.  The Court will have no objection to the Defendant being placed on Electronic Monitoring (EM) while participating in the program. Should the Defendant violate either the conditions of Electronic Monitoring (EM), or the rules at the Day Reporting Program the Defendant will serve the balance of the sentence without release privileges.
- Possession or use of any illegal controlled substances or alcohol forfeits the Huber (work release) privileges and any referral of reporting time.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, and DNA fees during the period of probation.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.

As a convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possess of any firearms or weapons at any time in the future - 941.29 Wis. Stats. makes it another felony for anyone who has been convicted of a felony to ever possess a firearm, carrying with it its own 10 year period of imprisonment or $25,000 fine or both. Possess Weapon as Convicted Felon - 973.176(1).
Defendant can't vote in any election until civil rights are restored.

Cooperate with the agent.
Defendant required to provide a biological specimen (DNA) to the State Crime Lab for testing  - 973.046 and 973.047.

AODA assessment with follow up care and treatment.
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. Random urine screens with no positive results.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David M Booczko

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Received, sealed, and filed with the court.

Defendant David M Booczko in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statements made as to the Sentencing by both counsel and the Defendant.  

Defendant sentenced to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction (HOC) with credit for 3 days time served. Court ordered the 1st 30 days of Defendant's sentence be without release privileges at the House of Correction (HOC). After this initial period of incarceration, if there are no major rules violations, and the Defendant is accepted into the Day Report Program, the Defendant may serve the balance of the sentence with release privileges to attend the Day Reporting Program.  The Court will have no objection to the Defendant being placed on Electronic Monitoring (EM) while participating in the program. Should the Defendant violate either the conditions of Electronic Monitoring (EM), or the rules at the Day Reporting Program the Defendant will serve the balance of the sentence without release privileges.

Possession or use of any illegal controlled substances or alcohol forfeits the Huber (work release) privileges and any referral of reporting time.

Court IMPOSED AND STAYED the sentence and placed Defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 years with the following conditions:
*  Cooperate with agent.
* Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, and DNA fees during the period of probation.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
*  AODA assessment with follow up care and treatment.
*  Random urine screens with no positive results.
*  Mental Health assessment and treatment.
*  Defendant required to provide a biological specimen (DNA) to the State Crime Lab for testing  - 973.046 and 973.047.
*  As a convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possess of any firearms or weapons at any time in the future - 941.29 Wis. Stats. makes it another felony for anyone who has been convicted of a felony to ever possess a firearm, carrying with it its own 10 year period of imprisonment or $25,000 fine or both. Possess Weapon as Convicted Felon - 973.176(1).
*  Defendant can't vote in any election until civil rights are restored.

Received and filed with court:
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form
*  Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement Form

Defendant David M Booczko in court with attorney Christina Balistreri for attorney Mark A. Pecora.  
Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.  Joint request for adjournment of sentencing made.

COUNT 1:  The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.   Request for adjourned date granted by the Court.  Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant David M Booczko in court with attorney Christina E. Balistreri for Mark Pecora.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Parties ask for an adjournment for further investigation.   Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant David M Booczko in court with attorney Christina Balistreri for attorney Mark A Pecora.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for plea and sentencing.  Parties request an adjournment.  Parties notified as of August 3, 2015, case will be assigned to Judge Konkol, branch 44, in room 316 of the safety building.  Defense counsel files a substitution against Judge Konkol.  State informs court that a substitution has been previously filed against Judge Stark, and that he is not entitled to another one.  Court reviews statue.  Court finds defendant does not have a right to substitution.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 8/3/2015 at 1:30 pm, branch 44.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant David M Booczko in court with attorney Mark A Pecora.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 6/2/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant David M Booczko in court with attorney Mark A Pecora.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Stark.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Fiorenza, Br. 03.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

The Court ordered no use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant David M Booczko in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3/9/15 @ 1:30pm
